scalf.cmsc335.project2

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • scalf.cmsc335.project2.Shape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThreeDimensionalShape, TwoDimensionalShape

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that provides the common fields and methods of all Shapes.

    This is a revised version of Shape.

    Changes

    05 SEP 2020

    • Removed the Scanner import and field.
    • Changed validateInput(String) to getInput(String).
    • Updated getInput to utilize JOptionPanes instead of the console.

    17 AUG 2020

    • Created the validateInput(String) method for use in all Shape objects.
      • Since the area/volume for all Shapes is stored as a double, I determined that it would be best to consolidate it in one method in the common ancestor class.

    Filename: Shape.java

    Author:
    Samuel Scalf
    Date:
    16 AUG 2020
    Updated:
    05 SEP 2020
    School:
    University of Maryland Global Campus
    Professor:
    Dr. Osama A. Morad, Ph.D.
    Course:
    CMSC 335 6380 Object-Oriented and Concurrent Programming (2208)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shape

        public Shape(int numberOfDimensions)
        Creates a new Shape with the specified number of dimensions.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getDimensions

        public int getDimensions()
        Returns a deep-copy of the int value of NumberofDimensions. This is accomplished by first storing the value in a temporary variable and returning the temporary variable.
        Returns:
        an int representing the number of dimensions

      • calculate

        public abstract void calculate()
        Calculates the calculated area or volume of the Shape. This method is polymorphic.

      • getInput

        double getInput(java.lang.String variable)
        Prompts the user for a value. This loops until a double value is entered. JOptionPanes are used for requesting input and displaying an error in the event invalid input is entered.
        Parameters:
        variable - The name of the requested variable, like radius.
        Returns:
        double value of user input
